Description: Pottery jar with a blunt pointed base and convex sides, which converge slightly to a small, rounded shoulder, above which is slightly flared neck finished with an everted rim. One side of the body is indented and decorated with applied and incised features in the form of the god Bes. The headdress of the representation forms one side of the neck of the vessel, decorated with a buff-coloured slip..
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Tell Dafana, "Qasr", east annex (C), chamber 9
Curator's comments: The Findspot number 9 is scratched on the object.
Bibliographic references: Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p.64, 65, 66 § 61, pl. xxxv, 65)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.94, fig.14, p.106, p.218, pl.60)
